sentence.text: Mutations in the gene encoding the nuclear matrix protein Matrin 3 have been found in familial cases of signal transduction, as well as autosomal dominant distal myopathy with vocal cord and pharyngeal weakness.

We previously found that spinal cord and muscle, organs involved in either signal transduction or distal myopathy, have relatively lower levels of Matrin 3 compared to the brain and other peripheral organs in the murine system.
